title: Tennessee coach Jeremy Pruitt yanks QB's facemask after critical fumble against Alabama
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: USA TODAY Sports' Paul Myerberg provides his opinion of the top three programs in the history of college football. USA TODAY

In a weird game filled with questionable officiating, injuries and an unexpectedly close margin, Jarrett Guarantano provided the most bizarre play of them all.

And it was followed by an outburst by Tennessee coach Jeremy Pruitt.

On fourth-and-goal from the Alabama 1 in the fourth quarter, with the Crimson Tide leading 28-13, Guarantano's attempt at stretching the football over the pile on a quick sneak attempt resulted in the ball getting smacked away by Alabama linebacker Shane Lee. Trevon Diggs then returned the ball more than 100 yards for a Crimson Tide touchdown, ending any idea of a Vols comeback and upset.

100-yard scoop 'n score for Alabama 😳 pic.twitter.com/o7fZE6GeYC — ESPN (@espn) October 20, 2019

Pruitt's frustration boiled over by the time Guarantano made it back to the sidelines, where the coach was seen tugging on the junior quarterback's facemask as he hotly discussed the play.

Don’t think coach is happy pic.twitter.com/9e5XEbJr35 — Busted Coverage (@bustedcoverage) October 20, 2019

Was it a planned sneak? ESPN announcers considered that it was a planned conventional run, given that offensive linemen were pulling. That could be the reason why Pruitt was so irate. And it wasn't the first time that Pruitt had been emotional on the sidelines in his two seasons as the Vols head coach.

“We’ve run two quarterback sneaks earlier in the game by pushing the pile,” Pruitt said. “We could either go back with it or run a sneak, and we elected to run a sneak and he shouldn’t have jumped over the top," Pruitt said postgame.

“He should have pushed it there over the middle."

Either way, the Vols' final chance at clawing back against the No. 1 team in the country was popped up into the air and returned for a touchdown. Pruitt was energetic throughout Saturday's game, and the fumble by Guarantano pushed him close to the edge.

I know you’re mad Jeremy Pruitt, but don’t do that. pic.twitter.com/knG3297Mar — Bryan Fischer (@BryanDFischer) October 20, 2019

Contributing: Associated Press
description: Tennessee coach Jeremy Pruitt was seen yanking Jarrett Guarantano's facemask following the quarterback's crucial fumble against Alabama.
